metadata.title: FIFA World Cup 2026 Betting Odds & Predictions
metadata.description: Compiled outright winner odds, group winner odds, golden boot odds, power rankings, and analyst predictions from major bookmakers and sports outlets
metadata.data_freshness_note: Outright and group winner odds primarily sourced from December 2025 post-draw lines. Prediction market data (Polymarket/Kalshi) updated through February 2026. Power rankings reflect January-February 2026 analysis. Odds will continue to shift as the tournament approaches.

outright_winner_odds.description: Odds to win the 2026 FIFA World Cup outright

teams.notes: Reigning European champions. Won Euro 2024. Top of FIFA rankings. Favored across all bookmakers.
8 wins from 8 qualifiers, 22 goals scored, 0 conceded under Thomas Tuchel.
Reached final in 4 of last 7 World Cups. Mbappe and Dembele provide elite attacking quality.
5th in CONMEBOL qualifying (8-4-5). New coach Carlo Ancelotti. World-class talent pool.
Defending World Cup champions. Won 2022 World Cup and Copa America. Messi's final World Cup.
Won Nations League beating Germany and Spain in penalty shootout. Ronaldo still in squad.
4-time World Cup champions. Strong qualifying campaign.
Lost just 1 of last 26 matches (on penalties). Scoring freely. Strong midfield and backline.
First World Cup since 1998. Beat Italy 4-1 in Milan to qualify. 37 goals in 8 qualifiers. Haaland leading the line.
Drawn in tough Group B with Switzerland and Canada.
Golden generation aging but still talented. Lukaku remains prolific.
Strong qualifying campaign. Drawn with Portugal in Group K.
In Group H with Spain. Historically strong World Cup pedigree.
Co-hosts. Favorable Group D draw. Never advanced past quarterfinals. Home advantage significant.
Reliable knockout stage team. Structural resistance in difficult groups.
2022 World Cup semifinalists. Won 16 straight matches. Added Brahim Diaz (switched from Spain). AFCON 2025 runners-up.
Quietly dangerous side built around Moises Caicedo. Resilient defensive structure.
Co-hosts. Favorable Group A draw. Historically strong World Cup performers.
2018 finalists, 2022 semifinalists. Aging but experienced squad.
Beat Brazil recently. Only 2 defeats in last 23 matches. Graduating from underdog to legitimate threat.
AFCON 2025 champions. Beat England 3-1. Sadio Mane leading a confident squad.
Cruised through qualifying with 26 points in 10 games. Salah and Marmoush deadly partnership.
Co-hosts. Alphonso Davies, Jonathan David, Cyle Larin, Tajon Buchanan all in prime years.
First ever World Cup. Won 7 of 10 qualifying games, topping group ahead of Cameroon.

group_winner_odds.description: Odds to win each World Cup 2026 group

A.notes: Playoff teams (Czechia +1200, Rep. of Ireland +3500, North Macedonia +10000) may also join this group.

B.notes: Playoff teams (Wales +1800, Bosnia & Herzegovina +1800, Northern Ireland +10000) may join. Italy not seeded as Pot 1.

C.notes: Brazil heavy favorite but Morocco a genuine threat. Brazil-Morocco clash likely decides group.

D.notes: USA -575 to advance to knockout stage. Favorable draw for hosts. Playoff teams (Slovakia +750, Romania +2000, Kosovo +2000) may join.

E.notes: Germany strong favorite. Ecuador the main challenger.

F.notes: Playoff teams (Sweden +850, Ukraine +900, Poland +1000, Albania +2000) may join. Japan a strong second seed.

G.notes: Belgium strong favorite. Egypt a potential upset threat with Salah and Marmoush.

H.notes: Spain overwhelming favorite. Uruguay the clear second.

I.notes: Potential Group of Death. Norway and Senegal both dangerous. Playoff teams (Bolivia +4000, Suriname +10000) may join.

J.notes: Argentina heavy favorite. Polymarket gives Argentina 75% chance to win group.

K.notes: Strong group. Colombia a serious threat to top it. Playoff teams (Jamaica +4000, New Caledonia +10000) may join.

L.notes: England heavy favorite with perfect qualifying record. Croatia experienced but aging.

golden_boot_odds.description: Odds for the 2026 World Cup Golden Boot (top scorer)

players.notes: Won 2022 Golden Boot with 8 goals. Slight favorite. Plays for Real Madrid.
Won 2018 Golden Boot with 6 goals. Scored 9 in 8 qualifiers. Plays for Bayern Munich.
2022 World Cup winner. Likely final World Cup. Plays for Inter Miami.
Norway's first WC since 1998. 37 team goals in 8 qualifiers. Plays for Manchester City.
NBC Sports lists at +1600; FOX Sports article lists +2000. Reigning Ballon d'Or winner.
Youngest player to represent Spain. Key to Euro 2024 triumph. 5 goals in 11 games post-Euros. Plays for Barcelona.
All-time international top scorer. Plays for Al Nassr.
Key striker for Argentina and Inter Milan.
Belgium's all-time leading scorer. Prolific qualifying campaign.
Brazil's star forward. Plays for Real Madrid.
6 goals and 4 assists in 6 qualifying matches. Scored Euro 2024 final winner.
Key attacker for Argentina. Plays for Atletico Madrid.
Brazil striker. Scored brace vs Serbia in 2022 World Cup.
Arsenal and England winger. Key creator and scorer.

golden_boot_odds.format_note: Expanded 48-team format with extra knockout round means top scorers may exceed the typical 5-8 goal range. Teams reaching the final play 7-8 matches.

power_rankings.title: The 10 sides looking most likely to reign supreme

rankings.notes: Team to beat. Won Euro 2024. Lost just 1 of last 26 (on penalties). Oyarzabal solved striker problem with 6 goals, 4 assists in 6 qualifiers.
In much better shape than Euro 2024 semis. Best backline and midfield in international football. Scoring for fun.
Reigning champions. Only gotten better since Qatar 2022. Coherent unit with quality everywhere. Messi still in arsenal.
Convincing qualifying. Only drew with Iceland preventing perfect record. New weapons emerging: Rayan Cherki, Jean-Philippe Mateta.
8 wins from 8, 22 goals scored, 0 conceded in qualifying. Thomas Tuchel made them impenetrable at the back.
Won Nations League beating Germany and Spain (penalties). Strong squad depth.
World-class talent but inconsistent under Ancelotti. Won just 4 of 8 recent matches.
2022 semifinalists. Won 18 matches in a row. AFCON 2025 finalists. Tournament pedigree proven.
First WC since 1998. Beat Italy 4-1 in Milan. 37 goals, 5 conceded in 8 qualifiers. Haaland plus elite supporting cast.
Beat Brazil recently. Only 2 defeats in last 23. Serious quality all over the pitch. Graduating from underdog to contender.
Top of FIFA world rankings. Euro 2024 champions.
Defending World Cup champions. Copa America winners.
Reached final in 4 of last 7 World Cups.
Perfect qualifying record under Tuchel.
Most decorated World Cup nation (5 titles).
Nations League champions.
4-time champions. Strong group draw.
Best form of any European side.
Dark horse. Haaland-led qualifying dominance.
Strong South American qualifier.
Hosts. Near top 10 after favorable draw.

power_rankings.title: Post-AFCON Power Rankings
power_rankings.rankings_note: Updated after Senegal won AFCON 2025, beating Morocco in the final

key_movers.notes: AFCON champions. Beat England 3-1. Surged up rankings.
AFCON final loss on home soil. Still dangerous but rattled.

prediction_markets.description: Real-time prediction market odds aggregated from Polymarket and Kalshi
prediction_markets.notes: 43+ outcomes available. Prices aggregate collective knowledge of thousands of participants. Updated in real-time.

dark_horse_picks.description: Dark horse selections from major sports outlets and analysts

picks.reasoning: First World Cup since 1998. Demolished Italy 4-1 to qualify. 37 goals in 8 qualifiers. Haaland is generational. Supporting cast of elite talent.
ESPN says 'close to being a legitimate contender.' Lost just 1 of 26 matches. Best backline and midfield in international football.
2022 semifinal was no fluke. Won 18 straight matches. AFCON 2025 finalists. Added Brahim Diaz. First African nation to reach WC semis.
AFCON 2025 champions. Beat England 3-1. Sadio Mane leading. Africa's standard bearer arriving with authority.
Beat Brazil. Only 2 defeats in 23 matches. Quietly graduating from underdog to legitimate threat.
Quietly dangerous. Built around Moises Caicedo. Resilient defensive structure. Consistent CONMEBOL qualifier.
Co-hosts. Alphonso Davies, Jonathan David, Cyle Larin, Tajon Buchanan all hitting prime. Jesse Marsch building cohesive unit.
Co-hosts with favorable group draw. Never past quarterfinals but home advantage is massive. Young, talented squad.
Cruised through qualifying (26 pts in 10 games). Mohamed Salah and Omar Marmoush deadly partnership.

analyst_predictions.description: Expert predictions and picks from major sports outlets

predictions.reasoning: Current favorites after European success. Top of FIFA world rankings.
Reached final in 4 of last 7 tournaments. Mbappe and Dembele arguably the two best forwards in world football.
Data model aligns with bookmakers. Commanding probability lead.
Post-draw analysis confirms Spain as clear favorite with easiest path.
Even after dropping points to Turkey, still the best team in the world. Enter 2026 as the team to beat.
Reigning champions topped initial power rankings. Scaloni's side only gotten better since Qatar.

group_stage_predictions.description: Expert predictions for group stage outcomes

A.notes: Mexico benefits from gentle draw as hosts.

B.notes: Italy not mentioned as favorite by NBC. Canada depends on Alphonso Davies ACL recovery.

C.notes: Brazil-Morocco clash decides group. NBC Sports boldly picks Morocco 1st.

D.notes: USA got much better draw than expected. -575 to advance.

E.notes: Germany and Ecuador expected to advance comfortably.

F.notes: Strong top two. Japan a serious dark horse.

G.notes: Belgium favored. Egypt the potential upset threat.

H.notes: Spain overwhelming favorite. Uruguay clear second.

I.notes: Potential Group of Death. All three of France, Norway, Senegal capable of advancing.

J.notes: Argentina 75% to win group per Polymarket.

K.notes: Strong top two. Colombia a genuine threat to top the group.

L.notes: England heavy favorite after perfect qualifying campaign.

group_stage_predictions.format_note: Top 2 from each group qualify automatically. Best 8 third-place teams also advance to Round of 32.

notable_movements.reason: AFCON 2025 finalists. Best ranking since April 1998.

key_narratives.description: Major storylines heading into the 2026 World Cup

narratives.title: Messi's Last Dance
narratives.detail: Lionel Messi likely playing his final World Cup at age 38. Argentina seeking back-to-back titles.

narratives.title: Ronaldo's Record Chase
narratives.detail: Cristiano Ronaldo aiming for records in what could be his final major tournament at age 41.

narratives.title: Spain's Golden Generation 2.0
narratives.detail: Lamine Yamal (18), Pedri, Gavi lead a young squad that already won Euro 2024. Can they add World Cup?

narratives.title: Haaland's World Cup Debut
narratives.detail: Erling Haaland finally on the World Cup stage after Norway's first qualification since 1998.

narratives.title: Africa's Rising Tide
narratives.detail: Senegal (AFCON champs), Morocco (2022 semifinalists), Egypt (Salah-led) all genuine contenders. Can Africa produce a first-ever World Cup winner?

narratives.title: Host Nation Advantage
narratives.detail: USA, Mexico, and Canada all co-hosting. USA (+8000) and Mexico (+8000) looking to capitalize on home support.

narratives.title: Expanded Format Wild Cards
narratives.detail: 48-team format with extra knockout round. More games means more upsets, fatigue management crucial. Golden Boot winner may score more than typical 5-8 goals.
